group_1.textRight: Don't worry; I think you can trust her.
I can only speak from my experience...
But I think your mother really does@love you.
Because I've known your mother since@Mitama was in first grade,
when you were just one year old.

group_1.textLeft: Oh yeah, Big Sis said you were her@homeroom teacher, too.

group_1.textRight: Your mother hasn't changed one bit@since I was a rookie.
She's still the same hard-working woman@who adores her daughters.
She's been very diligent with paperwork,
and remarkably proactive in meetings@with the school.

group_1.textLeft: That's just 'cause her life'll get hard@if we grow up to be bad kids.

group_1.textRight: Yes, she does worry about your school@life and your grades...
But when Mitama got into trouble,
she kowtowed to many people behind@the scenes to smoothen things out.
I don't think that's something that somebody@who just wants an easy life would do.
It's incredibly hard.
Your mother is someone who would freely jump@into a fire if it was for the sake of her children.
It's the same with you, Mii.
Even after Mitama got into trouble and@returned to Daito from Mizuna,
your mother was worried you'd be a target and@wouldn't be able to enjoy school anymore,
so she went around the teachers asking@for their help,
and they promised to make sure you@weren't bullied.

group_1.textLeft: That's true...the bullying we expected 'cause of the@whole thing with my sister never actually happened...

group_1.textRight: Your mother is very strong, too.
A long time ago, when you were badly@injured down at the riverbed,
Mitama and I were there, and were in@a total panic.
Your mother, on the other hand, remained@calm and gave you impeccable first aid.
She kept screaming your name, desperate@to make you conscious again,
but it paid off.
In the end, you just needed to undergo some tests@at the hospital, and you had no further problems.
Well, it stands to reason. You were just one@or two years old when it happened.
And at that time, I thought to myself...
...I want to be a mother like that@someday.

group_1.textLeft: (I didn't know about that at all.)

group_1.textRight: What do you think?@Can you trust your mother?
You're going to have to think about@how you'll face her from now onâ€¦

group_1.textLeft: ...Did you ever think that you didn't want@to have your baby?

group_1.textRight: Hmm, that's a great question.
...Truth be told, I've been incredibly@anxious about many things.
Like a massive upcoming earthquake,@or missiles flying overhead,
or people not getting their pensions,@or the murders that go on...
Every day, I'm constantly hearing these gloomy,@awful stories. It's a terrible world we live in.
There were times I wished I could keep@my baby in me forever.
But I decided to have one because I felt encouraged@by seeing people's happiness, too,
and by the wonderful mothers I know.

group_1.textLeft: I see...even teachers have things@they worry about.
I'm afraid I can't go play at your house.
You gotta stay home and keep things@nice and quiet for your baby!

group_1.textRight: Aw, what a shame.
